title: B field of wires - wire configuration with same B0

content.description: A long, straight wire carries a current <math alttext="I sub 0" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>I</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </math> toward the right, as shown in the figure. The magnetic field due to the current in the wire has magnitude <math alttext="B sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>B</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, which is a distance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> from the wire.
content.question: For which of the following configurations of long, straight wires does the magnetic field have the same magnitude <math alttext="B sub 0" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>B</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </math> at Point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows point P between two parallel horizontal wires. Point P is located a distance R over 2 below the top wire, and is located a distance R above the bottom wire. The top wire and bottom wire both carry a current I sub 0 to the right.

The figure shows point P between two parallel horizontal wires. Point P is located a distance R below the top wire, and is located a distance R above the bottom wire. The top wire carries a current I sub 0 to the left, and the bottom wire carries a current 2 I sub 0 to the right.
The figure shows point P located a distance 2 R above a long horizontal wire. The wire carries a current I sub 0, end sub, over 2 to the right.
The figure shows point P located a distance 2 R above a long horizontal wire. The wire carries a current 4 I sub 0 to the right.

content.answer: The figure shows point P between two parallel horizontal wires. Point P is located a distance R over 2 below the top wire, and is located a distance R above the bottom wire. The top wire and bottom wire both carry a current I sub 0 to the right.
